name: Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage
description: Tragedy! Santa; the toy giving folk-hero, and purveyor of fine Christmas goods, has had enough. Endless requests from greedy children wanting more and more every year, tax increases, pressure from elf unions, bills, reindeer!
minimum_requirements: Минимальные: ОС: Win XP SP3, Win 7 Процессор: 2.4GHz Dual core CPU Оперативная память: 2 GB ОЗУ Видеокарта: 512MB Shader Model 3.0 Nvidia GeForce 8800 GT or AMD Radeon HD 3870 DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 800 MB
recommended_requirements: Рекомендованные: ОС: Win XP SP3, Win 7 Процессор: 2.6GHz Quad core CPU Оперативная память: 4 GB ОЗУ Видеокарта: GB Nvidia GeForce GTX 560 or AMD Radeon HD 5850 DirectX: Версии 9.0c Место на диске: 800 MB

reviews.review_text: The halls are covered with elven entrails, Fa la la la la, la la la la.  Don't forget the shotgun shells, Fa la la la la, la la la la.  Massacre in the jolliest of jollies, Fa la la la la, la la la la. It's time to clean up all the bodies, Fa la la la la, la la la la.  See the blood dripping everywhere, Fa la la la la, la la la la. Santa's Rampage is fun alone or shared, Fa la la la la, la la la la.
disturbingly arousing
My Christmas tradition since 2013. Some people want to watch A Christmas Story. I want to clean up a workshop littered with what used to be elves.

♫♫cleaning santa's workshop♫♫♫ ♫♫hhmmm its full of dead elfs and blood♫♫ ♫♫and instead of cleaning im making a god damn mess♫♫

Love this game for £1.43 you can't beat it, just spent 2 hour's cleaning and burning bodies, didn't complete the job though something's are so hidden and hard to find/clean, Will carry on playing this untill i beat it.

This game is so amazing that I couldn't think of what I would be doing around Christmas every year, it's been there for me when I have been extremely bored, and this game is not the usual type I'd play. It's a physics interactivity type game, you're cleaning up after Santa's rampage, where all of the elves are dead. It's a huge mess, so it's going to require a lot of time to clean. Not only that, but they still release really awesome updates, 3 years later after its release, and I'm loving all the new features they've been working on.  What makes this game all the more amazing, is that the creator(s) haven't left this game yet, they still put love and time into it, and that's pretty much why I enjoy playing it every year, like I don't remember how all the last times went.  If you like a game where your job is to clean an entire building, then this game is for you!
Got this in a bundle and its a fun time waster for that price point. If you are unnerved by Christmas, then you may love this more or it will freak you out more.  7/10 in a bundle 5/10 at full price
Bloody hell...(no pun intended) This game is oddly satisfying... o.o
Cleaning is fun

This game is an odd concept that is delivered remarkably well; sick and funny in equal parts, both disturbing and satisfying. I cannot deny that it is calming to clean up after Santa lost his rag, but I feel that this won’t apply to everyone. This makes it a hard game to grade, for those who enjoy salivating the cleaning urge it will like scratching an internal itch; if the concept doesn’t grab you, it will feel like a waste of time. As long as you know what you are going into, I think you can have a lot of fun with this game; it would be nice to have a progress bar though.
Clean up all them ♥♥♥♥ and viscera in the freakin name of Chirstmas and Jesus Chirst will guide you to success with hacks like ghost, cleanup hax and random keybinds.
OMG I DONT EVEN CARE IF THE IDEA IS STUPID I PLAYED IT AND I LOVED IT END OF STORY

I played this off the back of watching a film by the name of 'Sunshine Cleaning', it's a charming yarn about a pair of sisters played by Amy Adams and Emily Blunt. One sister (Adams) is a smart determined single mother gritting it out as a cleaner to support a slightly problematic child whilst at the same time fitting in an affair with a married man who has absolutely no respect for himself, Adams or his pregnant wife!!....the other (Blunt) is caught half way between being a dreamer and a screw up. To cut a long story short out of necessity they form a crime scene cleaning company by the name of Sunshine Cleaning, burn down a house and decimate family relationships only to build them back up again.  Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Revenge doesn't feature Amy Adams or Emily Blunt, it doesn't even feature Alan Arkin as a slightly potty father selling popcorn out of the back of a sedan one week then struggling to shift seafood lovingly preserved in his bathtub the next....it did however teach me one thing, which is that this crime scene cleaning lark isn't for me.  Upon entering the grotto the game advise's me that Santa has had a break down and went ballistic with a shotgun. Elves are scattered everywhere, limbs are scattered everywhere, the walls and carpets are painted red. I spent 20 minutes walking around in circles following bloody footprints only to realise that they were my own as I'd stepped on an Elve's head when entering the grotto....this is a far cry from getting the hoover out on a Sunday afternoon and following it up with some light dusting and a few sprays of anti-bac surface cleaner. Every few mop strokes im having to ring it out in the water bucket, every few minutes im forced to freshen up the water in the bucket, it's feels like a job and for that the developers deserve massive praise.  'Sunshine Cleaning' 8/10 - Amy Adams shines in a touching drama about love, life & family.
Blood got glitched in floorrboards, but had a great 5 hour bonding experience 10/10 would clean again.
It's so good I love omfg have a wank to it.

Prior to playing Viscera Cleanup Detail, I would fanaticized about being a janitor. Not necessarily for the job itself, but I feel the 1997 movie   Good Will Hunting   may have had an influence. Every time I would ponder on the movie, I finish the thought train with, “what would it be like to be a janitor?” Perhaps Damon makes the job seem somewhat interesting; that I may one day find an unsolvable problem on a white board and know exactly how to solve it—or dissolve it, with some cleaner.  To the point. This game fulfilled my desire and allowed me to experience just how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a job it would be to be a janitor—especially after the jolly fat man has a freak-out.
This game is really stupid.. But its addicting at the same time. Its not a lot, but hey, nothing wrong with a $2 game.    **Some items tend to bug though the floor; overall good game

It is pretty fun, pretty cheap, and very replayable. Maybe just a teensy bit disturbing at first.   The cons- It has some glitches that you can work around with commands. Also, it doesn't have a save feature as of yet so you need to have a block of time free to play or leave it running if you have interuptions. The inability to save would be my biggest complaint.  The pros- burning everything. Smashing ornaments. Blowing yourself up. Shaking dead elves after a rough day. Seeing how dirty you can make it or how clean.  While I haven't tried playing with others yet I think that it would be pretty fun. Playing by yourself takes a pretty long time for a complete clean up.
Play this once a year with my friend, I've thought about nothing but playing this game on Christmast this year

As the title suggests, play the role of a janitor sent to clean up the aftermath of Santa's rampage through his workshop. When you first enter you'll be surprised to find just how bad the rampage was. Gameplay is pretty basic, clean up the workshop and dispose of Santa's victims to clear the game. The mop cleans up blood and soot, the tracker locates messes or objects, and your hands grab/throw things. The mop has two uses first is to clean and the other kind of acts as a mean to strike/hit objects. The tracker's blue scanner tracks nearby messes while the green tracks potential objects you need to dispose of to clear the stage in a 'hot-and-cold' style. Low slow beeps when nothing is near to high rapid ones the closer you get. With your hands you can pick up just about any object or activate machines to dispense tools to help you clean.  One machine will dispense water buckets used to clean your mop when it's absorbed too much filth. Another machine will produce special bins you can carry trash, items, and objects in to dispose of. Oddly enough the only way to dispose of dirty water, objects, and bins themselves is to drop it into the fireplace. Sometimes however the bucket dispenser will drop out TNT bundles or body parts which can make your task even more frustrating. It's recommended you keep a water bucket at hand to drop the TNT into as quickly as it appears to prevent it from exploding. Unfortunately this isn't information they tell you and I lost count how many times I had to flee from the room to prevent getting blown up. Adding insult to injury you then have to clean up the mess left behind.  The bins can be equally frustrating. Meant to make your task easier they can also make it tedious. Objects are easily knocked around and if you bump into the bin from the wrong angle expect it to tip over. They do give you the ability to rotate things back to a standing position via grabbing and using the activation button. However if you have anything in that bin expect it to go flying all over the room. I must have knocked over the same bin at least a dozen times or had to clean it up again because the objects went flying. For the most part if you fill it right and properly grab the bin it remains fairly sturdy when moving it around. So they do have some use.  Now the biggest annoyance has to be the messes themselves. Even after playing for a few hours, scouring every spot I could find there were still hidden spots I couldn't and choosing to 'Clock-Out' would deem an automatic failure. A tiny invisible splotch of blood you can't see, a smudge from an explosion. The tiny bulbs that hang on the tree and garland count as messes too if they leave a colored paint splatter upon breaking. Sometimes this can be on the ceiling out of reach because a stick of TNT went off. Only way to reach them requires cheating. Due to bugs the mess you need to mop up might be hidden under the floor preventing you from finding it too. The tracker is little help since it doesn't specifically show what you missed. So again in this case you may need to resort to using the 'KillNearbyMess' command to clear it. Currently the game is still in a beta-like stage so hopefully this will be fixed in later patches.  Overall the game is a novelty and can be fun if you only want to cause mayhem, especially for the price. But after you've beaten it (There's only the workshop.) then that's it, after all that you won't likely play it again. Tossing dead elves around or blowing things up with the TNT can only entertain for so long. If you have a friend who's already bought the game, try it out for yourself before you buy. In the long run there's other games that can offer more replayability than this. Viscera Cleanup Detail: Santa's Rampage for the price is pretty good, but frustrations and having to resort to cheating just to clear it prevents me from giving a recommendation for now.

As a  standalone  I would not recommend this game. The map is really small and I highly doubt there will be many more fixes or add-ons to this game. If you buy this along with the original Viscera Cleanup Detail then I think it is a welcome addition.

In all, this is a good game.   Let me start at the beginning. Viscera Cleanup Detail started as a standalone mini-game for Shadow Warrior. While it was boring cleaning up dead guys, the gore shocked most. Now in this edition, apparantly Santa got pressured by elves, dumb wish lists, and reindeer crap. He took a shotgun, a knife, and rage, and killed everyone. While this is disturbing for those young Steamers out there, once again, the gore shocked most into playing it repeatedly. The game features those surgeon simulator graphics, so it wasn't realistic. However, the graphics mean nothing. The only thing that caught players' attentions, was the shocking aftermath and story.   So in conclusion, the cleaning is boring for most, but the fact that Santa melted under pressure shocked players into enduring @#$! to clean it all up!

Still, it's fun and pretty entertaining to play as you figure out what exactly happened there. Definitely addicting for anyone who's mildly OCD, and I'd highly recommend for just a couple dollars!

I dont know about you but this is one of the creepiest experiences I've had on a sandbox game. Basically your a Janitor and your job is to clean up Santa's resent rage. Well what you find i sthe beauty of bloody elves in a more dark setting. Mostly recommended for people who like dead things and messing around. (You can play with friends TOO!)

I have been looking for a morbid Christmas game since the Santa Slayer demo, about 10 or more years ago, and this was pretty much what I'm looking for. Almost like a sequal to it honestly, since Santa goes on a rampage. The only difference is, you're the one cleaning up, instead of killing...or you can make a mess.  It's a pretty straight forward game, and not too fancy. You can make the mess way worse, sometimes without trying if you're not careful. Getting rid of the elf bodies takes some time, due to having to maneuver them to the bucket, without getting blood everywhere. I just got to the point where I burned them in the fireplace which excited me a bit too much.   All in all, for the price, I think it's pretty fun.

Such a fun and twisted game that made for a ton of laughs and some seriously messed up screen shots. Replay value is high just to see how bad you can jack the place up next time or how clean you can actually make the pad. A little glitchy at times when too much is happening on screen at same time but still enjoyable when quickly asdressed. Ridiculous amout of fun this title is. Cannot recommend enough if you want a fun and twisted hidden gem to play.

Very fun, and cute. Cleaning out santas office, I see a couple bundles of TNT. Oh, ill dispose of it. The little sticks of TNT didnt do much, but it made a little mess... ill get rid of the rest all together! So after ive gathered the rest of the TNT I can find on the map, I throw it in a hazmat bin into the fire and back up. and it explodes.... much bigger than I thought. I died. I didnt even think you could die. Huh.  So in comes my replacement, and I go to the water bucket machine. Better clean up myself, I suppose. I hear the machine grind, and expect a hand or chunk of meat to come out instead of water. Well, not exactly. Its another bundle of TNT. Lit. I die. Again. 10/10 fun game

Buy it for someone else if you want them to suffer as well.

If you haven't yet, deffinatly purchase this, it'll be one of the best few bucks you'll ever spend!

A game that makes you want to do something you dread IRL - clean. Hilariously fun, especially playing with a friend. So many WTF moments when all of a sudden something explodes and kills you, when the bucket of bloody water gets knocked over, and the damn bloody footprints that appear out of nowhere when you've already clean the area around you! Somewhat unpolished, buggy, glitchy. If that's something that really bothers you, steer clear for now. But for $2? How can you lose! Only complaint I have is connecting to a multiplayer game requires opening ports and inputting your hosts' Global IP manually. Other than that, it's unsettlingly fun. Still don't know what the sniffer tool does though. If somebody can enlighten me on this I would greatly appreciate it.

This game is - how shall I put it? - 'unique'. Simply put, although it will never win any Game of the Year awards, it's a cheap, stupidly fun game that seems to have brought to life Weird Al's 'The Night Santa Went Crazy'. If all that appeals to you, then go get this game. What are you waiting for?
For a (not so) quick and (not so) easy game that will kill time, THIS is the game for you.   Santa, you are a ****.

For those who haven't had a chance to play any variation of this glorious game, now is a better time than any. Besides the original alpha (which is still up for download on the dev's website) this is the only official independent release of the game. There was one that came with Shadow Warrior as well, and I can imagine that one is just as fun.  First of all, yes, this game is a joke. That's the point. It's witty, it's sarcastic, the concept is amazingly silly, but it's an extraordinary amount of fun. For a game that may as well have been titled 'Janitor Simulator 2013', I think this game has given me more pleasure for $2.49 than at least half the big brand games out there have on sale.  Don't get me wrong. This is a fairly one and one kind of game. I'm not saying the appeal will last forever. But with it's 13 achievements and cheap sale price, you can get at least 3 or 4 hours of fun out of this game. Not only that, but supporting it means you're providing the funds for the developers to keep making more. As we've already seen with Shadow Warrior, this medium provides the potential for dozens of parodies.  Viscera Cleanup Detail runs on the Unreal Engine 3, which means that any of game running on the Unreal Engine 3 has the potential of being ported easily for this game. This list includes, but is not limited to: Bioshock Infinite, Alice: Madness Returns, Borderlands 1 & 2, Deadpool, Dishonored, Devil May Cry, Mass Effect, Sanctum, Section 8, THIEF, Tribes: Ascend, XCOM, Outlast, Xeno Clash II, and on and on and on the list goes!  And for each game you could have different interactions and achievements, possibly even hard mode scenarios where you have to work around the NPCs that are there, such as cleaning up around workers in the slums of Finkton, or having to clean up around the club goers on Omega while being able to interact with the local barman. The potential for this game is all but endless.  My point is if you haven't had a chance to play this hilarious game, do so. Go and download the Alpha off their website (Google it ya bums!) and if you like it, spend the $2.49 and support the creators. I would very much like to see more of this game in the future.

A fun game to play for a couple of hours. Ive put countless hours in this game and have never fully beaten it yet. You literally play as the clean up crew after santa went AWOL and blasted everything in his workshop. The co-op online was a bit tricky, had to make my own server for any of my friends to be able to join (which took forever). Dont buy this for over 5 bucks

If you love the cheery christmas spirit hanging in the air while you pick up elf gibs-then this game is for you. The game itself is based around cleaning...dead body parts and blood, with the occasional self lighting dynamite thrown in to make you appreciate these simpler aspects. The physics are good, but when picking up a disposable box full of giblets and bullets, the objects inside will rattle about excessively-making for an annoying trip to the incinerator (in this case the fireplace) When you have picked up the bits, there is still the matter of mopping the floors and walls to deal with. Fairly simple: switch to the mop, dab the mess-when the mop turns excessively red and starts painting blood, give it thrust into a bucket of water from the nearest Splosh-o-matic (Don't spill it...) Rinse and repeat. Fun to play if your a neat freak, or find the stress of christmas is soothed by some not so jolly activities.
nothing suits christmas better than a bloody mess to leave you scarred for the rest of your life. I always wanted to be a janitor. 7/10

This is an amazing game in many different ways!!! You can mess with TNT and blow up bottles and papers ETC. You get to clean up blood and dead body parts and as groose and boring as that may sound it can give you hours of fun especially if your OCD and want to lean every square inch of Santas house. There are also two other games that go with the original and shadow warriors which just have new maps that you can clean and find new things in. The whole game series is amazing with a pretty nice look to it and it runs very smoothly even when recording. So if your a huge fan of good looking games, simulators ETC then buy this game plus when there are $2.49 deals for this game its a no brainer buy for this game!!!
